Easy Homemade Taco Meat (No Taco Seasoning)

August 7, 2017

As some of you probably saw on Instagram, I made taco salad today. I wanted to quickly provide you guys with a quick and easy homemade taco meat recipe. I was feeling for a taco salad this afternoon and didn’t have any taco seasoning, so I decided to make my own. It’s not difficult at all and all the seasonings and spices are to be used at your own discretion. I usually guesstimate the spices when I’m cooking so feel free to tweak it to your own taste buds.

This “taco meat” can be eaten on almost anything. I’ve eaten it on rice (in my non-keto days), with veggies, wrapped in a tortilla for burritos, and tacos. I chose to use Roma tomatoes because of their low water content. I didn’t want my salad to be wet, so I made it a point to choose Roma instead of tomatoes on the vine or hothouse tomatoes. The meat itself would be pretty “drippy” if the fat isn’t drained. I decided to make a taco salad with my homemade taco meat and topped it with sour cream, chopped Roma tomatoes, and old cheddar cheese for that sharpness but you can use any cheese that you like. I would recommend using a cheese with jalapenos for an extra kick.

This homemade taco meat recipe is really versatile so have fun with it. Enjoy!

AuthorSarah-Jane G.CategoryMeatDifficultyBeginner

Say goodbye to pre-packaged taco seasoning and awaken your taste buds with this easy homemade taco meat recipe! This recipe is multi purpose and can be eaten on rice, with veggies, in taco salad and in burritos.

Yields4 Servings
Prep Time2 minsCook Time10 minsTotal Time12 mins

 600 g Medium Ground Beef (Use lean if you like, medium is tastier)
 ½ Diced Onion
 1 tsp Minced Garlic
 2 tbsp Worcestershire Sauce
Seasoning
 2 Sprigs Fresh Thyme
 1 tsp Onion Powder
 1 tbsp Cumin
 1 tsp Black Pepper
 2 tbsp Cayenne Pepper
 2 tsp Adobo All Purpose Seasoning
 1 tsp Paprika

1

Saute Diced Onions with the oil of your choice until just wilted.

2

Add Medium Ground Beef and break apart with your wooden spoon. Add Minced Garlic. Continue Sauteeing on medium high heat for 2 minutes. Add Worcestershire Sauce.

3

Add, Black Pepper, Cayenne Pepper, Cumin, Adobo All Purpose Seasoning, Onion Powder, Paprika. Continue Sauteeing. Add Fresh Thyme last. Continue sauteeing on Medium Low heat until all the meat is browned.

Ingredients

 600 g Medium Ground Beef (Use lean if you like, medium is tastier)
 ½ Diced Onion
 1 tsp Minced Garlic
 2 tbsp Worcestershire Sauce
Seasoning
 2 Sprigs Fresh Thyme
 1 tsp Onion Powder
 1 tbsp Cumin
 1 tsp Black Pepper
 2 tbsp Cayenne Pepper
 2 tsp Adobo All Purpose Seasoning
 1 tsp Paprika

Directions

1

Saute Diced Onions with the oil of your choice until just wilted.

2

Add Medium Ground Beef and break apart with your wooden spoon. Add Minced Garlic. Continue Sauteeing on medium high heat for 2 minutes. Add Worcestershire Sauce.

3

Add, Black Pepper, Cayenne Pepper, Cumin, Adobo All Purpose Seasoning, Onion Powder, Paprika. Continue Sauteeing. Add Fresh Thyme last. Continue sauteeing on Medium Low heat until all the meat is browned.
